import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem continuous_at_iff_sequential_criterion {a b x₀ : ℝ} (hab : a ≤ b) (hx₀ : x₀ ∈ Icc a b)
    (f : ℝ → ℝ) :
    (ContinuousAt f x₀ ∧ (x₀ = a → ContinuousWithinAt f (Set.Ici a) x₀) ∧ (x₀ = b → ContinuousWithinAt f (Set.Iic b) x₀)) ↔
    (∀ (xₙ : ℕ → ℝ), (∀ n, xₙ n ∈ Icc a b) → Tendsto xₙ atTop (nhds x₀) → Tendsto (f ∘ xₙ) atTop (nhds (f x₀))) := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
• f is a function defined on a closed interval $[a,b]$ and $\overline{x} \in [a,b]$ [tc_1]
• f is continuous at $\overline{x}$ [def_1]
Therefore, we conclude:
• For any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists a $\delta > 0$ such that for any $x \in [a,b]$, if $|x - \overline{x}| < \delta$, then $|f(x) - f(\overline{x})| < \epsilon$ [l1].

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
• $\{x_n\}$ is a sequence of points in $[a,b]$ such that $\lim_{n\to\infty} x_n=\overline{x}$ [def_2]
• A positive $\delta$ is given (from the definition of continuity of f) [l1]
Therefore, we conclude:
• For the given $\delta > 0$, there exists an integer $N$ such that if $n \ge N$, then $|x_n - \overline{x}| < \delta$ [l2].

• For this $\delta$, there exists an integer $N$ such that if $n \ge N$, then $|x_n - \overline{x}| < \delta$ [l2]

theorem continuous_at_iff_sequential_criterion {a b x₀ : ℝ} (hab : a ≤ b) (hx₀ : x₀ ∈ Icc a b)
